remarks: A sufficient condition for the derivative to be bounded, for the quotient of two functions.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
statement:
dvdivbd.s $e |- ( ph -> S e. { RR , CC } ) $.
dvdivbd.a $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. X ) -> A e. CC ) $.
dvdivbd.adv $e |- ( ph -> ( S _D ( x e. X |-> A ) ) = ( x e. X |-> C ) ) $.
dvdivbd.c $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. X ) -> C e. CC ) $.
dvdivbd.b $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. X ) -> B e. CC ) $.
dvdivbd.u $e |- ( ph -> U e. RR ) $.
dvdivbd.r $e |- ( ph -> R e. RR ) $.
dvdivbd.t $e |- ( ph -> T e. RR ) $.
dvdivbd.q $e |- ( ph -> Q e. RR ) $.
dvdivbd.cbd $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. X ) -> ( abs ` C ) <_ U ) $.
dvdivbd.bbd $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. X ) -> ( abs ` B ) <_ R ) $.
dvdivbd.dbd $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. X ) -> ( abs ` D ) <_ T ) $.
dvdivbd.abd $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. X ) -> ( abs ` A ) <_ Q ) $.
dvdivbd.bdv $e |- ( ph -> ( S _D ( x e. X |-> B ) ) = ( x e. X |-> D ) ) $.
dvdivbd.d $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. X ) -> D e. CC ) $.
dvdivbd.e $e |- ( ph -> E e. RR+ ) $.
dvdivbd.ele $e |- ( ph -> A. x e. X E <_ ( abs ` B ) ) $.
dvdivbd.f $e |- F = ( S _D ( x e. X |-> ( A / B ) ) ) $.
dvdivbd $p |- ( ph -> E. b e. RR A. x e. X ( abs ` ( F ` x ) ) <_ b ) $.
$d E b x $.
$d F b $.
$d Q b x $.
$d R b x $.
$d S x $.
$d T b x $.
$d U b x $.
$d X b x $.
$d ph x $.
